Lyric:
[00:11.420]Once upon a time you dressed so fine
[00:13.340]Threw bums a dime in your prime,
[00:17.500] didn't you?
[00:20.750]People called said beware doll, you're bound to fall
[00:24.920]You thought they were all kidding you
[00:30.620]You used to laugh about
[00:36.590]People who were hanging out
[00:41.640]Now you don't talk so loud
[00:46.000]Now you don't seem so proud
[00:50.620]About having to be scrounging your next meal
[00:59.630]How does it feel, how does it feel?
[01:08.240]To be on your own, without a home
[01:14.760]Like a complete unknown, like a rolling stone
[01:22.060]
[01:32.400]You've gone to the finest schools, alright miss lonely
[01:37.340]but you know you only used to get juiced in it
[01:40.660]Nobody's ever taught you how to live out on the street
[01:47.160]And now you're gonna have to get used to it
[01:52.380]You say you never compromise
[01:59.760]With the mystery tramp, but now you realize
[02:03.520]He's not selling any alibies
[02:06.920]As you stare into the vacuum of his eyes
[02:14.270]And say do you want to make a deal?
[02:22.650]
[02:23.370]ďźChorusďź
[02:23.740]How does it feel, how does it feel?
[02:33.540]To be on your own, without a home
[02:42.180]Like a complete unknown, like a rolling stone
[03:01.380]Oh, you never turned around to see the frowns
[03:05.360]On the jumpers and the clowns when they did their tricks for you
[03:10.640]You never understood that it ain't no good
[03:15.390]You shouldn't let other people get your kicks for you
[03:20.430]You used to ride on your chrome horse with your diplomat
[03:26.990]Who carried on his shoulder a siamese cat
[03:32.950]Ain't it hard when you discovered that
[03:37.310]He really wasn't where it's at
[03:43.390]After he took from you everything he could steal
[03:50.310]
[03:52.570]How does it feel, how does it feel?
[04:01.980]To be on your own, without a home
[04:11.950]Like a complete unknown, like a rolling stone
[04:31.000]Princess on a steeple and all the pretty people
[04:35.940]They're all drinking, thinking that they've got it made
[04:40.150]Exchanging all precious gifts
[04:45.440]You better take your diamond ring, you better pawn it babe
[04:50.440]You used to be so amused
[04:57.480]At Napoleon in rags and the language that he used
[05:02.120]Go to him he calls you, you can't refuse
[05:06.640]When you ain't got nothing, you got nothing to loose
[05:12.450]You're invisible now, you've got not secret to conceal
[05:21.510]How does it feel, how does it feel?
[05:30.040]To be on your own, without a home
[05:39.870]Like a complete unknown, like a rolling stone
